title: Grades 9-12: Level I, Novice Mid to Novice High Proficiency
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

9B5241267E6046BCB12BB07CD5937B7D.description: describe people, objects, and simple situations orally and in writing using a mixture of words, phrases, and simple sentences.

389859DCDC2E4A71BF3FBD9310596927.description: state and support an opinion or preference orally and in writing; and

5230DF18B2AF451293497139C09CAAAB.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally and in writing using a mixture of words and phrases and some simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

FD17011C182B42189BF6C6BD6D64D3F7.description: identify cultural practices from authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials.

D7D1DEBB020745DC8A3CB2E520E18C03.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in highly contextualized texts, audio, and audiovisual materials; and

3D333F7AAA54487A970A862095EBBF1C.description: identify key words and details from fiction and nonfiction texts and audio and audiovisual materials;

9D6F6F8595F2477787D8661B00BBCA3B.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials in everyday contexts;

34FCAC37660742FB9E9E629B1428C16C.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends sentence-length information from culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within highly contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

9D92D2C124A1407BB626AABDC27628BC.description: participate in written conversation using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and style.

7B6373B349AC470A8D3A527F4F0A4139.description: participate in spoken conversation using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and gestures; and

865C21227FD442AD9802ECA36E3C266D.description: articulate requests, offer alternatives, or develop simple plans in spoken and written conversation;

37E769EC48E5485FAEEE7F6168E19EBB.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, or must do in spoken and written conversation;

860F2AF88DE34F7BB71067733754996A.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences in spoken and written conversation;

80954AF763FC474893EDEBC81E5941DF.description: ask and respond to questions about everyday life in spoken and written conversation;

76054B7ECA274E89B4FC282E8C5810B9.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in rehearsed and unrehearsed situations in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of words and phrases and some simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

83E8DED3FA5D471F9DEC193FED0D99BE.description: Level I, Novice Mid to Novice High Proficiency
